p: Natural Dermatophilus congolensis infection of camels has been reported, for the first time, in Kenya, Sudan, the UAE, and Saudi Arabia in the mid-1990s (Bornstein 1995, Gitao et al. 1998a; Wernery and Ali 1990) (Fig. 20.8). According to camel owners in the Butana region of Sudan, this disease has never been observed before in their herds (Gitao et al. 1998b).
